بسم اللّه الرّحمن الرّحيم المملوك أبوا علي منجّا
يقبّل الأرض بالمجلس السّامي الأجلّي العالي الموقّر
السّعيد ابا أبا ركريا زكري زكريّاء وفّقه اللّه وينهي إليه أن ولد
المملوك جا اليوم من عند أهلنا وهم يشتكوا
قلّت النّفقة وذكروا أن أن ما هي بقي عندهم عيش
وأنا أريد من بسط المولا نفقة تنفيقه للعيال من تفضّل
المولا وإحسانه وهيّو وهو يرسم الولاپــه الولاية
على المولا والمملوك منتضر تفطّل المولا
وإحسانه بقليل قمح للعيال والسّلام عليك

In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate. The slave Abū ʿAlī Munajjā In the name of God, the Merciful, the Compassionate. The slave Abū ʿAlī Munjā
kisses the ground before the sublime, the most exalted, the lofty, the reverend
and auspicious seat Abū Zakarīyā - may God give him success! - and reports that the son and auspicious seat Thabāt Karīm - may God give him success! - and reports that the son
of this slave has come today from our family (or relative) who have complained about of this slave has come today from our family who have complained about
the lack of funds; they have mentioned that it is for them the source of livelihood.
I wanted to request [your] the Master's granting of expenses for these youths from [your] the Master's grace
and benevolence. He (i.e., my son) pledges allegiance and benevolence. Hurry forward stipends [to them]. Peace be
to [you] the Master. This slave is (i.e., I am) waiting for [your] the Master's grace upon [you] the Master. This slave is (i.e., I am) waiting for [your] the Master's grace
and benevolence in [granting] a small amount of what for the sake of the young people. Peace be upon you! and benevolence in [granting] a small amount of what for the sake of the youths. Peace be upon you!
